intro: Capanemia australis, commonly known as the southern capanemia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, pentagonal flowers that range in color from pink to purple. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and riverbanks. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and often covered in fine hairs.
